H0.text: What name is given to the home of a beaver. Damhouse

H1.text: What name is given to the home of a beaver. Burrow

H2.text: What name is given to the home of a beaver. Hut

H3.text: What name is given to the home of a beaver. Lodge

A4.text: Beavers build dams and lodges using tree branches, vegetation, rocks and mud; they chew down trees for building material. Dams restrict water flow, forming ponds, and lodges (usually built in ponds) serve as shelters.

A5.text: Without such material, or when lodges are not needed, beavers dig burrows into a bank to live.
